intro: Chamaesyce laciniata, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant in the family Cariophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often lobed or toothed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements.
